summary: This is an email chain from July 23-24, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It reports he was on suicide watch, had marks on his neck, and claimed his bunkmate had threatened him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive on the floor of his cell at MCC, with marks on his neck, claiming not to recall what happened and that his bunkmate had threatened him.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's bunkmate at MCC who claims he had headphones on and was not paying attention when Epstein was found; Epstein claimed Tartaglione had threatened him.

connections.description: Were bunkmates in the same cell at MCC; Epstein claimed Tartaglione had threatened him in the days prior to the incident.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in MCC Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found on the floor of his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, unresponsive but breathing, with red stretch marks along his neck. He claimed no recollection and said his bunkmate Tartaglione had threatened him.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Following the incident, protocol dictated Epstein be placed on suicide watch.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell at MCC, breathing but with red marks on his neck.
Epstein claimed he had no memory of the event and alleged his bunkmate, Tartaglione, had threatened him in the preceding days.
Tartaglione, the bunkmate, stated he was wearing headphones and unaware of what happened to Epstein.
The MCC was investigating the incident, and the U.S. Attorney's Office discussed whether the FBI should be more active in the investigation.
Following protocol, Epstein was placed on suicide watch after this incident.
